title: [BEAM-13005] [Playground] Implement local cache for pipelines' states
body:
Add interface to work with pipelines' cache. The cache is able to: - set value by pipelineId and subKey into cache - set expiration time - return values by pipelineId and subKey Additionally, add local cache as an implementation of this interface to test playground locally. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-4424] Execute hooks in enabling order
body:
Resolving BEAM-4424. * Maintain the enabled order of hooks, and execute in that order. * Allow hooks to be disabled. * Switch the default remote logging to use an Init hook, so runners may override the behavior as desired. * Add significant testing to the hooks package. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-13640][BEAM-12883] Add MetadataDynamicCoder to support encode-decode for new fields in Metatdata
body:
This PR is a continuous work for https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/15510.

Currently there are 2 Coders for Metadata: default one: `org.apache.beam.sdk.io.fs.MetadataCoder` and enhanced one `org.apache.beam.sdk.io.fs.MetadataCoderV2`, the last can also decode-encode `lastModifiedMillis` and it is done in a new coder in order to support backward compatibility.

This will be hard to maintain, we will need to create a new coder for any new field that will be added to `Metadata`.

So, as suggested in this comment: https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/15510#issuecomment-928390587, I came up with new generic coder : `MetadataDynamicCoder`.

`MetadataDynamicCoder` can decode/encode any new fields added to `Metadata` by sending getter, setter and coder.

For example creating coder for `lastModifiedMillis`:

``` java
 new MetadataDynamicCoder()
        .withCoderForField(
            VarLongCoder.of(),
            Metadata::lastModifiedMillis,
            Metadata.Builder::setLastModifiedMillis);
```

I chose to get explicit getter/setter to avoid reflection which has bad impact on performance.

title: Release guide: minor updates
body:
Notes about clearing out old docker images and unlocking the gpg signing key. - With the Docker images, it was using an older pip version with an older dependency resolution algorithm, so the `pip check` afterwards failed. Technically we should probably be aiming at a specific image version, but I'm not familiar enough. - When I run `git tag -s` it doesn't prompt for a key passphrase, but just prints out an error. title: [BEAM-12371] [BEAM-12373] Fixed page navigation
body:
Refactored the page navigation logic in order to fix its issues. ### Issues fixed - Non-matching scrolling position and selected navigation item - ```Uncaught TypeError``` caused by a missing arrow image in navigation items ### Expected behavior after changes #### Scrolling - The scroll position and the selected item should match - Expands all items down to the chosen one - Following a specific link also expands all items down to the chosen one #### Clicking - Clicking an unselected item scrolls the page to its heading and expands its immediate children - Clicking an already selected item toggles its expand-collapse behavior ------------------------ ----------------------------

title: Minor: Replace generic external.py links in multi-language documentation with links to pydoc

This isn't exhaustive though, there are still places where we link to other files on github, rather than API Docs. `ValidatesRunner` compliance status (on master branch) --------------------------------------------------------

title: Use daemon thread to report lull operation and move code to FnApiWork…
body:
…erStatusHandler Use a deamon thread guarantees that the lull operations are checked with fixed time interval instead of relying on trigger of runner process_bundle_progress request (which may not be happening frequently as needed if no work split is intended). Code has been moved from sdk worker to the worker status handler since all logic of printing thread dump is also there. Removed full thread dump logging since it is often unreadable in logs plus there are other alternatives to get pretty print full thread dumps such as requesting sdk_status page from runner. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-13015] Remove the overhead of SpecMonitoringInfoValidator initialization
body:
Minor improvements to precreate required labels sets and to use map lookup instead of loop over list for type and urn. title: [BEAM-12998] [Playground] Environment service
body:
1. Adding structures to manage environments that need for different parts of the app. * BeamEnvs contains all environments related to ApacheBeam. These will use to run pipelines * ~LogWriters contains writes for the logger. Writers should implement io.Writer interface.~ logging will be implemented in next PRs * ServerEnvs contains all environment variables that need to run the server. 2. Service operates with environment structures: ServerEnvs, LogWriters, BeamEnvs and contains methods to extract some values from os.env ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-11936] Fix some errorprone warnings
body:
Fixed errorprone warnings listed here: - **AssignmentToMock**: Fields annotated with /@Mock/ should not be manually assigned to. - **AnnotateFormatMethod**: Annotate method with @FormatMethod. Doing so gives compile-time rather than run-time protection against malformed format strings. - **AutoValueFinalMethods**: Make toString(), hashCode() and equals() final in AutoValue classes, so it is clear to readers that AutoValue is not overriding them. - **BadImport**: Importing nested classes/static methods/static fields with commonly-used names can make code harder to read, because it may not be clear from the context exactly which type is being referred to. Qualifying the name with that of the containing class can make the code clearer. - **BigDecimalLiteralDouble**: new BigDecimal(double) loses precision in this case. - **JodaToSelf**: Use of Joda-Time's DateTime.toDateTime(), Duration.toDuration(), Instant.toInstant(), Interval.toInterval(), and Period.toPeriod() are not allowed. - **MathAbsoluteRandom**: Math.abs does not always give a positive result. Consider other methods for positive random numbers. - **UnusedMethod**: The presence of an unused method may indicate a bug. This check highlights private methods which are unused and can be safely removed without considering the impact on other source files. - **UnnecessaryParentheses**: These grouping parentheses are unnecessary; it is unlikely the code will be misinterpreted without them. For reference https://errorprone.info/bugpatterns ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: Allow multiple Python worker processe to share the same VM.
body:
The use of this feature is guarded by a new SDK capability. This is an alternative to starting up multiple docker images to get around the fact that the GIL often prevents more than one CPU to be saturated by a worker. It has the benefit of amortizing the overhead of managing and setting up VMs across multiple worker processes. The notion of "siblings" is introduced, because the container needs to be started up with an explicit worker id, which needs to be provided to identify itself to the runner for retrieval of provisioning information. The runner can then respond with any number of additional, worker ids that indicate identical workers should be started up with this same provisioning information. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: Minor: Fix `Iterable[SplitResultResidual]` type errors
body:
This is partially related to BEAM-7746, and partially a bugfix caught by typehints. We can see here that `delayed_applications` is supposed to be a `List[Tuple[Operation, SplitResultResidual]]`: https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/dc4a6a92c0ca31268352fbe12d8399c69dc1caf9/sdks/python/apache_beam/runners/worker/bundle_processor.py#L1009-L1012 https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/dc4a6a92c0ca31268352fbe12d8399c69dc1caf9/sdks/python/apache_beam/runners/worker/bundle_processor.py#L1070-L1078 But `DoOperation` is appending a `Tuple[Operation, **Iterable**[SplitResultResidual]]`. This PR flattens the `Iterable[SplitResultResidual]`. It also modifies `SimpleInvoker.invoke_process` to match the signature in the parent, `DoFnInvoker.invoke_process`. `ValidatesRunner` compliance status (on master branch) --------------------------------------------------------

title: [BEAM-9918] Make TryCrossLanguage match non Try API
body:
Try* versions of functions in the beam package should match the APIs of their non-Try counterparts, other than returning an error. That TryCrossLanguage didn't is an oversight. Given the experimental state, this breaking change seems relatively safe, and most usage should be directed through `beam.CrossLanguage` anyway. Main functional change is to pre-set coders on the outbound types incase they are needed later by cross language expansion. Real output pcollections are generated against the returned MultiEdge. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-12984]: Add support to collection PCollections from composites
body:
Composites were being incorrectly pruned out in the PipelineFragment stage. title: [BEAM-12628] make AvroCoder#useReflectApi default to true
body:
following up on discussion from https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-12628, this changes the default value of AvroCoder#useReflectApi to `true`. This means that by default, avro string fields will get decoded as `CharSequence`s backed by `java.lang.String`s not `org.apache.avro.util.Utf8`s. This matches Beam's behavior prior to version 2.30. cc @RyanSkraba , @udim ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable.
